config_description: Replica factor is explicitly set, regardless of keyspace or datacenter. This is the replica factor within the datacenter, like NTS.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration code checks if initial tokens are specified, if not, it checks if an allocation keyspace is specified. If neither are specified, it chooses a number of tokens at random. If initial tokens are specified, it uses those tokens. If an allocation keyspace is specified, it uses the token allocation algorithm to generate suitable tokens. If an allocation local replica factor is specified, it uses that to allocate tokens.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'allocate_tokens_for_local_replication_factor' configuration in the system depends on when new nodes are added to the cluster or when the replication factor within the datacenter needs to be adjusted. This configuration is triggered when bootstrap tokens need to be allocated for new nodes or when the replication factor within the datacenter changes.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'allocate_tokens_for_local_replication_factor' configuration option on the system is significant as it directly affects the token allocation process for new nodes in the cluster and the replication factor within the datacenter. Setting this configuration incorrectly can lead to uneven distribution of data or inefficient replication strategies within the datacenter.
